translation.en: [announcer] First, an Olympic champion,
Bruce Jenner!
It's all over. It's all over.
[Caitlyn] I've always had these issues going through me,
but without them, I don't think I ever would have accomplished what I did.
translation.ko: 하지만 그런 문제가 있었기에 여기까지 올 수 있었다고 봐요

translation.en: I was just so average.
Well, actually, I was below average.
I was dyslexic,
and I had identity issues.
But then, in fifth-grade gym class,
the coach says, "Run around the chairs," and timed every kid.
translation.ko: 코치님이 달리기를 시키고 모든 학생의 시간을 쟀어요

translation.en: I wound up having the fastest time in the whole school.
translation.ko: 제 기록이 전교생 중 가장 빨랐죠

translation.en: My life changed forever at that point.
If I would have been average,
good student, no identity issues,
translation.ko: 성적도 잘 받고 정체성 혼란도 겪지 않았다면

translation.en: I wouldn't have needed sports.
But for me, I needed it…
because I was different.
Nobody knew it, but down in my soul, I was different.
So I built this Bruce character.
[Caitlyn] And Bruce was a good person. Bruce did a lot with his life,
translation.ko: 브루스는 좋은 사람이었어요 많은 것들을 이루었죠

translation.en: and I'm very proud of what he was able to accomplish.
translation.ko: 브루스가 이룬 것들을 보면 자랑스러운 기분이에요

translation.en: Honestly,
I would kind of like to honor him.
But, you know what?
Caitlyn was always living down deep inside.
translation.ko: 마음속 깊은 곳에서는 케이틀린이 살고 있었답니다

translation.en: Hey, girl! [whistles]
Come here. Come here, come here, come here.
-What are you doing? What? I know. -[dog panting]
translation.ko: 뭐 하고 있었어? 그래, 나도 알아

translation.en: This is a very cute shot we've used.
We're in Hawaii, and I'm taking Kendall and Kylie,
translation.ko: 켄들과 카일리를 데리고 하와이에 갔을 때예요

translation.en: and I'm putting 'em on top in the air like that.
And they thought that was just great fun.
Actually, this is kind of interesting.
I got a Guinness World Record,
and it's the fastest time to reach one million followers on Twitter.
translation.ko: '트위터 팔로워 100만 명 최단 시간 내 달성'

translation.en: I did it in four hours and three minutes.
You know who I beat out?
Barack Obama did it in five… 5.4 or something like that.
I beat him out by an hour.
And, actually, here's… I had framed, "Happy Father's Day."
My phone's ringing.
It's in the other room.
It's Mom.
Well, you're being filmed right now.
I don't need to be filmed, honey.
I know you don't need to be filmed. Don't worry.
translation.ko: 엄마는 찍힐 필요 없죠 걱정 마세요

translation.en: All right, I'll call you in a little bit.
-[Esther Jenner] Love you. -Love you. Bye.
[Esther] Bye.
That's Mom.
My mother, 92.
And still sharp as a whip.
But she's actually been a great support to me over the years.
translation.ko: 지난 몇 년간 제게 큰 힘이 되어주셨어요

translation.en: Great support,
because, you know, I lost my dad way before I transitioned, any of that.
translation.ko: 전환을 시작하기 한참 전에 아빠는 돌아가셨거든요

translation.en: That's always been a regret, that my dad didn't know my story.
translation.ko: 아빠에게 말하지 못한 게 후회로 남아 있어요

translation.en: I had a good relationship with my dad.
We were always close because of sports.
He loved Bruce. You know, his boy.
Never knowing my whole story.
When I was ten, eleven,
I would sneak into my mom's closet.
And if the parents were all gone, I would dress up,
translation.ko: 부모님이 집에 안 계실 때면 엄마 옷을 입어보고

translation.en: try things on,
put some lipstick on.
Scared to death I would get caught, but I never did.
translation.ko: 걸릴까 봐 무서웠지만 걸린 적은 없어요

translation.en: It just was so taboo to do.
I always wondered, "Am I doing this for, like, a high?"
"Is that the excitement? Am I just, like, a risk-taker?"
So I've just always dealt with confusion in my soul.
translation.ko: 그런 식으로 항상 혼란에 빠져 살았어요

translation.en: But when sports came around,
it became that little arena where I could escape.
translation.ko: 그런 것에서 도피할 수 있는 나만의 공간이 되어 줬죠

translation.en: The place where I could shine.
When it came to sports, he'd be into basketball.
translation.ko: 스포츠 얘기를 하자면 처음엔 농구에 빠졌다가

translation.en: And when basketball was over, he was into track.
And when track was over, he was into waterskiing.
translation.ko: 육상 시즌이 끝나면 수상스키에 빠지곤 했어요

translation.en: So, he was very, very competitive.
[Caitlyn] To be honest, because of being dyslexic
and not having confidence in myself intellectually,
I never thought I'd go to college,
but this small school in Lamoni, Iowa, Graceland College,
translation.ko: 아이오와주 라모나이의 작은 학교 그레이슬랜드 대학교에서

translation.en: offered me this little deal to play football.
And that's where I met Chrystie.
[Chrystie Scott] I met Bruce the first day of school.
This person just came running up to me that I'd never met
translation.ko: 생전 처음 보는 애가 제 앞으로 달려오더니

translation.en: and said, "Will you go to the movie with me Friday night?"
translation.ko: "크리스티 스콧" 금요일 저녁에 영화 보러 가자고 하더라고요

translation.en: And I…
"Okay." And then he ran away.
He was really funny,
and he didn't know how handsome he was.
He was just the boy next door.
I remember we were talking about gymnastics…
translation.ko: 하루는 둘이서 체조에 대해 얘기하고 있었는데

translation.en: and he said, "Oh, I love gymnastics."
And then he did handsprings and backflips across the lawn,
like, he was just gone.
It was so surprising and so impressive,
and I was just learning how he could do anything.
translation.ko: 브루스는 뭐든 할 수 있다는 걸 알아가고 있었죠

translation.en: He could just do anything.
[Caitlyn] January 2nd, 1969.
I was playing linebacker to try to block a punt.
I got through the line. [rocket sound] Gone.
Just getting ready to jump,
and the single safety hit me right in my knee
when it was planted firmly in the ground.
Bang. Tore it up.
And I thought, "That's the end of sports. I'm done with that."
translation.ko: 그때 제 스포츠 인생이 끝날 거라고 생각했어요

translation.en: "I don't think my knee's gonna make it through that."
translation.ko: 무릎이 회복할 수 없을 줄 알았죠

translation.en: And I remember seeing him walk around with a cast on his leg,
translation.ko: 다리에 깁스를 한 채로 걸어 다니던 브루스는

translation.en: and he would sit around and sulk.
Moody. It was a horrible time for him when he was injured.
translation.ko: 예민했고요, 부상당하고 나서 끔찍한 시기를 보냈어요

translation.en: [Caitlyn] I didn't know what I was gonna do. I didn't know if my knee would come back.
translation.ko: 앞날이 막막하게만 느껴졌고 무릎은 나을 것 같지도 않았고

translation.en: I didn't think I would make it through that,
and I didn't know what my future was.
[Chrystie] But LD Weldon, the track-and-field coach,
translation.ko: "LD 웰던" 그런데 육상 코치 LD 웰던이

translation.en: got his hands on him and said,
"I think you'd be better at the decathlon,"
and the rest is history.
[LD Weldon] I was really impressed with Bruce because he'd listen to you
translation.ko: 전 브루스를 높이 삽니다 제 말을 귀담아듣고

translation.en: and he had a desire to just do the very best he could possibly do.
translation.ko: 능력을 최대한 발휘하려는 욕망을 가진 선수죠

translation.en: [Caitlyn] I had no idea what I was getting into,
translation.ko: "무릎 수술도 멈출 수 없는 제너" 영문도 모르고 발을 들였지만

translation.en: but my sophomore year, I ran my first decathlon.
That one race,
that changed everything.
One race.
I remember walking up to the line,
and the adrenal glands just hit.
-[echoing] Bam! -[starting pistol fires]
[Caitlyn] My heartbeat went from 80 to 180, just like that.
And I'm thinking,
"If there was ever an event that's got my name on it, this is it."
It just intrigued me. The history behind it intrigued me.
1912, the winner of the first decathlon was Jim Thorpe.
And the king of Sweden said to Jim,
"You are truly the greatest athlete in the world."
So they give you that title.
And that was pretty much my obsession from that point on.
That year, I actually broke the school record
translation.ko: "캔자스 릴레이 10종 경기 제너 우승" 그해 학교 기록도 경신했고

translation.en: for the decathlon at Graceland.
And then my senior year, in 1972, I made it on my first Olympic team.
translation.ko: "주 대회 우승" 졸업반이었던 1972년에는 첫 올림픽 팀에 선발됐죠 "군계일학 브루스 제너"

translation.en: I was a nobody.
I never should have made it on the team, but I did.
translation.ko: 팀에 들어갈 자격이 없었지만 그래도 입성했어요

translation.en: It was by far the biggest athletic thrill of my life.
translation.ko: 운동선수로서 느낄 수 있는 가장 짜릿한 경험이었죠

translation.en: [Caitlyn] The decathlon is ten events.
There are five events the first day, five events the second day.
But each event contradicts the next.
Shot put, you can get bigger and stronger and throw the shot farther.
translation.ko: 투포환은 크고 강할수록 멀리 던질 수 있지만

translation.en: But the next event's the high jump. You can't get off the ground.
translation.ko: 다음 종목 높이뛰기에서 몸을 띄우는 게 힘들어요

translation.en: Where is that balance?
Not only physically,
but mentally.
The competition is so intense.
Nobody ever beats the decathlon.
I didn't have a chance.
I got tenth.
[Caitlyn] But then the most significant thing happened after.
translation.ko: 그런데 정말 놀라운 일은 그다음에 벌어졌어요

translation.en: I wanted to stay around to watch the ceremony.
I'd never seen an Olympic gold medal ceremony happening right in front of me.
translation.ko: 제 눈앞에서 금메달 수여식을 구경한 적이 없었으니까요

translation.en: I stood up on the side,
and I watched this guy, Nikolai Avilov of the Soviet Union,
translation.ko: 소련의 니콜라이 아빌로프가 금메달 받는 걸 지켜봤는데

translation.en: and I was totally impressed with this human being.
He had just won the decathlon.
And watched him receive his medal.
I said to myself,
"That's it."
"That's what I want right there."
After he came home,
Bruce talked about Avilov a lot.
I remember Bruce talking about Avilov as godlike.
translation.ko: 브루스가 아빌로프를 신처럼 묘사하던 기억이 나요

translation.en: [Caitlyn] Avilov was a very gifted athlete.
[Caitlyn] And he had such a big impact on my life.
He had good skills.
He was talented. He obviously worked hard.
translation.ko: 타고난 재능도 있었고 물론 노력도 많이 했죠

translation.en: But mentally, he was extraordinarily strong.
translation.ko: 그런데 정말 강했던 건 그의 정신력이에요

translation.en: He had everything.
He was from the Soviet Union in the middle of the Cold War.
The Soviet Union would have athletic camps for young kids
translation.ko: 당시 소련은 아이들을 위한 운동 캠프를 운영해서

translation.en: where they're trained, and they're worked, and they're put into sports schools,
translation.ko: 그곳에서 훈련한 아이들을 스포츠 학교로 보내

translation.en: and they're gonna cultivate these great athletes.
That was Avilov.
And I always thought,
"They never would have picked me to be on one of those teams."
I had this war going on inside me.
"Are you really trans? Are you gay?"
I didn't know anything about that, so you just keep your mouth shut.
translation.ko: 아는 게 전혀 없으니 입을 다물고만 있었어요

translation.en: But I thought, "What if I take the next four years of my life
and every minute of every day,
I test myself to see how good I could become at something?"
translation.ko: '내가 얼마나 발전하는지 시험하는 데 써보면 어떨까?'

translation.en: An opportunity to prove myself, prove my masculinity,
translation.ko: 나 자신을 증명하고 내 남성성을 증명하고

translation.en: prove myself to the world that I'm a worthwhile human being.
translation.ko: 나도 가치 있는 인간임을 증명할 기회 같았어요

translation.en: If I can win an Olympic gold medal,
maybe I can prove these issues don't even exist.
[Chrystie] I never understood why it was that important.
translation.ko: 왜 그렇게 금메달이 중요한지 그땐 이해 못 했어요

translation.en: But I did know that he was struggling with this dissatisfaction within himself.
translation.ko: 하지만 자신에 대한 불만족으로 괴로워한다는 건 알았죠

translation.en: So we got married,
and I told him, "I can support you,
and I can help you get to those track meets,
and, you know, let's do this."
I got a transfer to San Jose, and we moved in spring of '73.
translation.ko: 제가 산호세로 이직하면서 1973년 봄에 이사를 했어요

translation.en: I found this apartment next to San Jose City College,
translation.ko: 산호세 시티 칼리지 옆에 한 아파트를 찾았는데

translation.en: and then the one that was in the back, overlooking the track,
translation.ko: 건물 뒤쪽에 있는 집에서 트랙이 내려다보이는 걸 보고

translation.en: I said, "This has gotta be the one."
Wanna go for a run, Berth? Come on, let's go.
See you in an hour, Bruce.
My life back between 1972 and 1976,
very simple.
I got up and I trained.
Chrystie and I were living in this little one-bedroom apartment,
translation.ko: 크리스티랑 둘이서 방 하나짜리 아파트에 살았는데

translation.en: and we thought we'd love to have a little dog.
I saw in the paper that there was, like, ten puppies,
and she was the one that was on the outside.
And Bertha became my best friend.
Went to every workout,
and I dug a hole so she could go under the fence.
Come on, Berth!
Trained six to eight hours a day, every day, 365 days out of the year.
Just get it in, get it in, get it in, get it in.
I didn't have a coach. I had to do all my training on my own,
translation.ko: 코치는 없었고 모든 훈련을 홀로 해야 했어요 크리스티와 저뿐이었죠

translation.en: so it was just us.
translation.ko: 모든 훈련을 홀로 해야 했어요 크리스티와 저뿐이었죠

translation.en: 15.1, Bruce. Not too bad!
Snap it up next time.
[Caitlyn] This was in the '70s.
You couldn't make any money in the sport. The last year of the amateur athlete.
translation.ko: 아마추어 시절의 끝자락이라 운동으로 돈을 벌 수 없었죠

translation.en: So I got a job part-time as an insurance agent,
and Chrystie was a flight attendant.
So between the two of us, we could make ends meet.
translation.ko: 둘이 버는 돈으로 생계유지는 할 수 있었어요

translation.en: And then on the weekends,
I was competing in track meets all over the world.
translation.ko: 육상 대회에 나가려고 전 세계를 돌아다녔죠

translation.en: At night, I'd dream about the Games, I'd dream about the technique.
translation.ko: 밤에는 올림픽 꿈을 꾸고 운동하는 꿈을 꿨어요

translation.en: I was obsessed with getting the most out of myself.
translation.ko: 제 능력의 한계를 끌어내는 데에만 집착했어요

translation.en: [commentator] On the left of your screen is Bruce Jenner.
-This is not a great event for Bruce. -[starting pistol fires]
-[commentator] Mirabeau… -[Caitlyn] I'm not a great sprinter,
so the 100 meters was always a challenge.
[commentator] …but to keep pushing to get that time.
[Caitlyn] I was frustrated
because I needed to get better.
translation.ko: "캔자스 릴레이 10종 경기 제너 4위" 더 잘하고 싶었거든요

translation.en: [Chrystie] He was an incredible athlete,
but it just seemed like he was always struggling with his form on the hurdles.
translation.ko: 허들 넘는 자세 때문에 매번 힘들어하는 것 같았어요

translation.en: Come on, Bruce!
Bruce really needed somebody he could train with.
This is one.
This is a picture taken at City College, and this is Bruce, back…
translation.ko: 시티 칼리지에서 찍은 사진인데 이게 브루스고…

translation.en: This was back in our training days.
We were pretty buffed out back then.
Bruce hanging on my arm.
I had read an article where Bruce Jenner had just won an all-comers meet,
translation.ko: 이 기사는 브루스 제너가 대회에서 우승했다는 내용인데

translation.en: and here's a picture of this great-looking guy running,
translation.ko: 사진 속에서 멋진 청년이 달리고 있죠

translation.en: and I'm thinking, "Yeah, I'm gonna go to San Jose."
I go into the YMCA, and lo and behold, there's Bruce.
translation.ko: YMCA에 들어갔더니 놀랍게도 브루스가 있는 거예요

translation.en: He's doing a weight workout.
Walks up to me and basically says, "Hey, I wanna train for the decathlon."
translation.ko: 저한테 와서 그랬어요 '10종 경기 훈련을 하고 싶어'

translation.en: And I went, "Okay. Follow."
[Stryker] We'd started running together, going to the track together.
translation.ko: 같이 달리기도 하고 트랙에도 나가고 웨이트도 하기 시작했어요

translation.en: We started lifting together.
The hardest part about this is trying to get the weight up on top of you, okay?
translation.ko: 가장 힘든 부분은 무게를 위로 올리는 거야

translation.en: Put 'em on your knees, and then lean back and kick one leg and the other leg, right?
translation.ko: 무릎 위에 얹고, 뒤로 기댄 다음 한 다리씩 쳐올리면 돼 차례대로 드는 거지

translation.en: Sort of one right behind each other and get it up. Okay. [grunts]
translation.ko: 한 다리씩 쳐올리면 돼 차례대로 드는 거지

translation.en: [Vince] When we trained, he'd talk about Nikolai Avilov.
translation.ko: 같이 훈련하는 동안 니콜라이 아빌로프 얘기도 했어요

translation.en: Bruce always said, "This is the guy I'm gonna have to beat to win."
translation.ko: 브루스는 항상 아빌로프를 이겨야 우승할 수 있다고 했죠

translation.en: He wanted to break his world record.
translation.ko: 그의 세계 기록을 깨고 싶어 했어요

translation.en: So we would do clean and jerks.
This is not just lifting weights. This is an athletic move.
We got that up to over 300 pounds.
Even after the weights, we'd go back out and run again.
translation.ko: 그렇게 웨이트가 끝나면 또 밖에 나가서 뛰었어요

translation.en: He would talk about running that 1500 meters
and running Avilov down at the end.
Every day, he seemed to get faster,
more powerful.
He started to gain his momentum and winning competitions.
[commentator] There you see Bruce Jenner, shows tremendous speed. There he goes.
translation.ko: 브루스 제너가 보이네요 놀라운 속도입니다 출발합니다

translation.en: -And that's a good jump. -[grunts]
[commentator] You can hear the grunt.
I always felt mentally weaker than everybody else.
That became my greatest asset.
I was a lot more dedicated.
I was a lot more intense about it.
I wasn't told to do this. I wasn't brought up to do this.
translation.ko: 누가 시켜서가 아니라 그렇게 키워져서가 아니라

translation.en: It was me. I wanna be better than everybody else,
translation.ko: 이게 내 모습이니까 남들보다 잘하고 싶었죠

translation.en: I wanna train harder than everybody else,
because I needed that in my life.
The year before the Olympics, people started recognizing Bruce.
translation.ko: 올림픽이 열리기 1년 전부터 사람들이 브루스를 알아봤어요

translation.en: [commentator] Bruce Jenner of San Jose, California.
He's out to better his record at the Summer Olympic Games in Montreal.
translation.ko: 몬트리올 하계올림픽에서 기록 경신을 노리고 있죠

translation.en: They knew that he was a favorite to compete against Avilov.
translation.ko: 아빌로프의 유력한 대항마라는 걸 본인도 알고 있었죠

translation.en: The pressure was really on then.
Next year is a biggie, right?
-Ooh, you can say that again. -Are we gonna get it?
I feel confident that Freddy and myself are gonna be right in there.

[chanting] Go, Jenner, go! Go, Jenner, go! Go, Jenner, go!

translation.ko: 10종 경기의 9번째 종목 창던지기가 시작될 무렵이면 선수들의 몸은 지칠 대로 지쳐 있습니다

Avilov remains third.

[Caitlyn] The last event, the 1500 meters, that's what the decathlon's all about.

You think you're pretty tough, okay?
1500 meters is for the tough guys,

Because I wasn't afraid of pain.
[commentator] This is one of those moments

-[woman] Go, Bruce! -Don't stop, Jenner!

[commentator] He's putting on the kick.
Bruce Jenner is kicking up the back straight.

He wants the world record.

Lytvynenko trying to hold on.
Bruce Jenner is striving.

Bruce Jenner has hit the world record in the decathlon sideways!
translation.ko: 브루스 제너가 10종 경기에서 세계 신기록을 세웠습니다! "세계 신기록 8,618점"

translation.en: [commentator] The crowd on its feet, roaring its appreciation
translation.ko: 관중이 일어나서 선수가 보여준 엄청난 노력에 뜨거운 환호로 답합니다

translation.en: of a tremendous effort
translation.ko: 선수가 보여준 엄청난 노력에 뜨거운 환호로 답합니다 "브루스 제너 - 미국 금메달"

translation.en: by the 26-year-old man from San Jose, California.
Nikolai Avilov walking so wearily across the track.
translation.ko: 니콜라이 아빌로프가 지친 모습으로 걸어갑니다 "니콜라이 아빌로프 - 소련 동메달"

translation.en: There's the pain of the decathlon.
Bruce Jenner is still upright and refuses to let fatigue pull him down.
translation.ko: 브루스 제너는 여전히 달리며 피로에 굴복하기를 거부합니다

translation.en: My goodness!
[Caitlyn] No matter how hard I ran the race,
I would never fall at the finish line.
'Cause I've been through a lot in my life.
And I had to fight to get there.
[Caitlyn] And nobody knew…
[Caitlyn] …what this moment was actually all about.
translation.ko: 그 순간이 제게 어떤 의미인지 알지 못했어요

it was pretty amazing. And…
he came over to give me a hug.
I stepped over the banister, and he gave me a hug, and…
translation.ko: 전 난간을 넘어 내려갔고 브루스는 저를 안아주면서…

translation.en: [sniffles] He said, "We did it."
It was a wonderful moment that he gave me.
He said, "We did it."
When he was up there on the podium,
I could see his face.
And I knew him, and I knew that he was struggling not to cry.
translation.ko: 울지 않으려고 애쓰는 중이라는 걸 알았어요

translation.en: And he looked over at me and saw me crying, and then he laughed.
translation.ko: 그러다 울고 있는 저를 보더니 활짝 웃었죠

translation.en: [Caitlyn] I am standing on the same platform as all of these guys before me.
translation.ko: 챔피언들이 섰던 자리에 저도 서 있었어요

translation.en: But… I'm scared to death.
What's my life going to be like from this point on?
[Bruce] That was real! I don't bite!
You were going down that 1500 meters, and I said, "If you can run that hard
translation.ko: 네가 1,500m를 달릴 때 내가 뭐랬는 줄 아냐? '아들놈도 1,500m를 뛰는데 내가 담배를 왜 못 끊어?'

translation.en: -in the 1500 meters, I can quit smoking!" -[laughs]
translation.ko: '아들놈도 1,500m를 뛰는데 내가 담배를 왜 못 끊어?'

translation.en: -And I mean it. -Deal! Stick around a little longer.
[Caitlyn] I climbed every mountain.
I accomplished everything I could possibly accomplish.
translation.ko: 내가 이룰 수 있는 건 모두 이루었어요

translation.en: Bruce Jenner, Olympic champion.
[Caitlyn] World's greatest athlete.
But I was still the same old person with all the same old issues.
translation.ko: 하지만 똑같은 문제를 겪는 똑같은 사람이었죠

translation.en: And then I remember the next day, uh, waking up, went into the bathroom.
translation.ko: 그다음 날 아침에 일어나서 욕실에 들어갔는데

translation.en: Uh, the medal was sitting there on the counter.
And I didn't have a stitch of clothes on, but the medal around my neck,
translation.ko: 실오라기 하나 안 걸친 상태로 금메달을 목에 걸고

translation.en: looked into a full-length mirror and said,
"What the hell did you just do?"
It's a great pleasure to welcome the Olympic decathlon winner.
translation.ko: 올림픽 10종 경기 우승자를 기쁜 마음으로 모시겠습니다

translation.en: Bruce Jenner is with us tonight.
[host] Bruce.
[host] And later, there is Bruce Jenner.
-Bruce Jenner. -Bruce Jenner.
You're probably getting tired of congratulations,
but, uh, really, what a super magnificent performance it was.
Yeah. It's been about seven weeks now since the Games have been over,
and, yeah, my life really has changed.
[Caitlyn] After the Games, they literally had traffic jams of people
translation.ko: 올림픽 후로 저를 보겠다고 사람들이 거리를 가득 메우고

translation.en: and cabs stopping in the middle of the street
running out to shake your hand.
Rich Harkins called Jenner's effort at the Montreal Olympics
translation.ko: 리치 하킨스는 제너가 몬트리올에서 보여준 모습을 두고

translation.en: "one of the outstanding performances of this decade."
In the beginning, it was kind of fun. He was a hero.
translation.ko: 처음에는 재밌었어요 브루스가 영웅이 된 거죠

translation.en: [Vince] He was the ultimate hero. The world's greatest athlete.
All of a sudden, you're in the limelight all the time.
Everywhere you go, people know who you are. It's gotta be different.
translation.ko: 어딜 가든 사람들이 알아봤죠 인생이 바뀐 거예요

translation.en: I'm Bruce Jenner. I know a lot of races are really won on the starting blocks.
translation.ko: 브루스 제너입니다 많은 레이스의 결과가 스타팅 블록에서 결정됩니다

translation.en: [Caitlyn] Did I build this character up so big and so publicly…
translation.ko: '브루스'라는 캐릭터로 워낙 대중적인 인기를 몰다 보니

translation.en: "Bruce," that I'm stuck with him?
translation.ko: 저와 뗄 수 없는 관계가 됐어요

translation.en: I spent a good part of my life getting ready for that day.
translation.ko: 그날을 준비하기 위해 긴 세월을 바쳤습니다

translation.en: I put in a lot of years and downed a lot of Wheaties,
translation.ko: 시간도 많이 쏟았고 위티스도 많이 먹었죠

translation.en: because a complete breakfast with Wheaties is good tasting… and good for you.
translation.ko: 위티스와 함께 아침을 맞으면 맛도 좋고 건강에도 좋답니다

translation.en: [man] Take it from Bruce Jenner. Wheaties is the Breakfast of Champions.
translation.ko: 브루스 제너가 보증합니다 챔피언의 아침 식사, 위티스

translation.en: We spent a lot of time together, even after the Olympics.
translation.ko: 올림픽이 끝난 후에도 함께 많은 시간을 보냈어요

translation.en: But he had a lot of things coming at him. Endorsements, acting…
translation.ko: 하지만 브루스는 일이 많았죠 광고 찍고, 연기하고…

translation.en: Look, a guy with your athletic ability… I mean, you're a natural.
[laughs] Well… Wait a minute, wait a minute. What's this all about?
Eventually, he had to move on, but life does that to you.
translation.ko: 결국 자기 길을 갔어요 인생이 그런 법이죠

translation.ko: '스포츠 일러스트레이티드'에서 브루스의 인생이 성공으로 가득할 거라더군요, 맞나요?

translation.en: -Does that make sense? Is that right? -Well…
translation.ko: 브루스의 인생이 성공으로 가득할 거라더군요, 맞나요? 글쎄요, 몬트리올에서 있었던 일로

translation.en: I think the rest of my life will be a lot more interesting

translation.ko: 인생이 흥미로워지긴 하겠지만 성공은 잘 모르겠네요

translation.en: [Chrystie] It was just hard to catch our breath,
and no privacy.
For Chrystie and I, the dynamics of the relationship was totally different.
Young ladies all over the world have, uh, gotta say,
translation.ko: 전 세계의 젊은 여성들이 그럴 겁니다

translation.en: "Wow, there's the decathlon champ," and, uh…
My wife and I are very close together,
and it's made it a little bit difficult on her sometimes, uh,
all of a sudden, the immediate change in our lives.
[Chrystie] That change was difficult for me.
But we know now that there's other issues that were brewing at the time.
translation.ko: 다른 문제도 있었다는 걸 지금이야 알죠

translation.ko: 올림픽 덕분에 정체성에 대해 생각하지 않아도 됐었는데

translation.ko: 이제 내 문제를 마주해야 할까 봐 겁이 났어요

translation.en: People love a good story like this.
The all-American kid, the wife who's working.
translation.ko: "브루스, 크리스티 제너" 건실한 미국 청년과 직장에 다니는 아내의 이야기

translation.en: I didn't think I could live up to that.
translation.ko: 그 기준에 맞춰 살아갈 자신이 없었어요

translation.en: Even though we were having challenges in the marriage,
we wanted to start a family.
So we had Burt.
[Bruce] There he is. Burt Jenner.
-Age… Uh, how many days? -[Chrystie] Five days.
Say something to 'em, Burt.
There you go. You want the mic?
You can tell he's a Jenner. He goes right for the mic.
-[Chrystie] Burt, this way! -Hey, Burt, there's Mommy!
-[Chrystie] Burt! Hi! -There's Mommy!
[Burt Jenner] As early as my memories start,
I knew there was something different about my dad.
Before the Olympics, my dad was…
was a nobody, you know, that nobody had ever heard of,
translation.ko: 올림픽 이전의 아빠는 무명이었죠 "버트 제너" 아무도 아빠를 몰랐어요

translation.en: but after the Olympics, she was the world's greatest athlete…
translation.ko: 하지만 올림픽 이후로 세계 최고의 선수가 되었고

translation.en: …which is a blessing and curse at the same time.
[Caitlyn] I love being a dad.
My kids were wonderful,
but it was another distraction from who I am.
[Chrystie] He told me once how he was really unhappy.
And what I was hearing was that he was unhappy with me.
translation.ko: 제게는 저와 함께여서 불행하다는 말로 들렸어요

translation.en: [Caitlyn] It was just this massive secret in my life I couldn't talk about.
translation.ko: 절대 털어놓을 수 없는 엄청난 비밀을 품고 있었죠

translation.en: She didn't know that I was struggling with all this stuff in my head.
translation.ko: 혼자 이런 고민을 한다는 걸 크리스티는 모르고 있었어요

translation.en: I didn't want people to know me and know who I was.
translation.ko: 사람들이 내 모습에 대해 알게 되는 게 싫었어요

translation.en: I just saw him needing to grasp onto something.
And I told him,
"When you've decided to see a therapist, then I'll come home."
But he didn't.
It is what it is.
[Caitlyn] I thought when Chrystie and I went our separate directions
translation.ko: 크리스티와 갈라섰을 때 스스로 제 문제를

translation.en: that I could figure myself out.
I basically isolated myself from the world.
I wound up all by myself in a shack in Malibu.
I was suffering badly from gender dysphoria.
translation.ko: 성별 불쾌감으로 심각한 고통을 받고 있었죠

translation.en: And that was the beginning of the worst six years of my life.
translation.ko: 그때부터 6년 동안 인생 최악의 시기가 시작됐어요

translation.en: [Burt] I remember I was at my grandmother's house.
And my dad flew down to pick me up.
And this was…
at least ten years after they had been divorced.
They never hung out.
That was when my father had told my mom that,
he-- she had started to transition.
[Caitlyn] I remember watching TV,
and on the news,
they had a report from the Orange County Transgender Association.
translation.ko: 오렌지 카운티 트랜스젠더 협회의 보고서 내용을 발표하더라고요

translation.en: On the average of around one a week, somewhere in the United States,
translation.ko: 평균적으로 일주일에 한 번 미국 어딘가에서는

translation.en: an individual is undergoing an operation to change his or her sex.
translation.ko: 성별 전환 수술을 받는 사람이 있다고 합니다

translation.en: The operation has become much more prevalent
than the general public has realized.
I called 'em up, said that I was looking for a therapist.
translation.ko: 연락을 취해서 치료사를 찾고 있다고 했어요

translation.en: I couldn't tell 'em my name or who I was.
And for the first time, I could really kind of sit down
and try to, with a professional, try to figure myself out.
translation.ko: 전문가와 함께 저에 대해 논할 수 있었어요

translation.en: It was hard for me to understand at first.
Started taking hormone pills
and had electrolysis to get rid of the beard, and…
I'll never forget just having to get up out of the middle of class in sixth grade…
translation.ko: 잊지 못할 기억이 있어요 6학년 때 수업을 듣다가

translation.en: uh, because I was about ready to break down in tears,
and nobody knew why.
And I just got up and ran out of the room.
And just went and cried in the hallway.
But it wasn't because my dad was gonna transition. It was…
I was afraid my father was going to transition into someone
translation.ko: 성전환을 마치고 나면 다른 사람이 돼서

translation.en: and go somewhere, and I would never see my father again.
translation.ko: 내가 알던 아빠를 볼 수 없을 것 같아서 그랬어요

translation.en: Yeah, those were… Those were tough times.
I tried with transition, but I was too scared.
Too scared.
Five, six months later, I met Kris, and she was great for me.
translation.ko: 반년 후 크리스를 만났는데 제게 좋은 영향을 줬어요

translation.en: She pulled me out of my funk and kept me going,
getting back into life as Bruce.
I can't do the other things, so let's just be a good Bruce.
translation.ko: 성전환은 못 하겠으니까 브루스로 잘 살아야겠다 싶었어요

translation.en: Kris, will you have Bruce to be your husband?
Will you pledge yourself to him, in all love and honor?
I will.
[photographer] Here we go. One, two, three, smile!
Bruce, smile!
Here it is.
A romantic kiss for my beautiful, pregnant wife… -[laughs] -…on our property.
translation.ko: 임신한 미모의 아내와 로맨틱한 키스를 나눌 겁니다

translation.en: -Okay, ready? -Where we'll spend the rest of our lives. This is it. Mmm. Okay.
Here comes our kids. They're so excited about the first day of school.
translation.ko: 애들이 나올 거예요 학교 첫날이라 잔뜩 들떴어요

translation.en: -Here they come. -[Kris laughs]
[Bruce] We'll go with Khloé first.
Now, Khloé, I know you're so excited about your first day of school.
translation.ko: 클로이는 학교 첫날이라 무척 기대하고 있지?

translation.en: Uniform girl. Here's Kimberly. Yes…
translation.ko: 교복을 입는 거야 이 친구는 킴벌리예요

translation.en: [Caitlyn] I loved being a dad. I loved carpooling kids.
translation.ko: 아빠로 사는 게 좋았어요 학교에 데려다주는 것도

translation.en: I loved giving 'em advice and bringing all these kids up.
translation.ko: 이런저런 조언도 해주며 아이들을 양육하는 게 좋았죠

translation.en: The first thing on the calendar is the puppet show.
…two, three, go!
[Kris] Hi, Kylie!
[Caitlyn] But the issue is not going away.
Whatever happens, I always want you to know that Daddy loves you,
translation.ko: 무슨 일이 생기든 아빠는 너를 사랑한단다

translation.en: and I think you're a wonderful little girl.
And could I have a kiss?
We're still recording. Okay.
Now, what do we have to say?
We have to say, "Hi, everybody, it's Christmas 1997!"
Oh my gosh, she's going so fast!
She's going so fast!
[Caitlyn] I was experimenting a lot.
[Caitlyn] And I thought, "Maybe I can survive
translation.ko: 남들 안 보는 곳에서 여장하는 것으로 만족하며

translation.en: by just cross-dressing behind closed doors and still keep the old Bruce around."
translation.ko: 남들 안 보는 곳에서 여장하는 것으로 만족하며 브루스로 살아보려고요 경기 출발선에서 어린 제너 팬들을 만났어요

translation.en: Here at the start of the race, we got all the Jenner kids here.
translation.ko: 경기 출발선에서 어린 제너 팬들을 만났어요

translation.en: [woman] Brody's here?
I remember one time I was at the Marriott in Orlando, Florida.
translation.ko: 한번은 플로리다주 올랜도의 메리어트에 간 적이 있어요

translation.en: All I had to do all day is give one one-hour presentation.
I had the rest of the time to myself.
And I thought, "I can sneak out, get in the car, just drive around."
translation.ko: 그래서 몰래 나가서 드라이브를 하고 싶어졌어요

translation.en: Just that little bit of freedom.
Drove around for an hour and came back,
translation.ko: 한 시간 드라이브를 하고 숙소로 돌아왔어요

translation.en: and I'm walking through the lobby towards the elevator…
and kinda going by the bar,
and this guy comes running up to me,
says, "I love trans women."
Ran down the hall, slammed the door.
My heart was pounding, and I was scared to death.
translation.ko: 심장은 터질 것 같고 겁에 질려 있었죠

translation.en: And I'm thinking, "That was so close to getting caught."
[Caitlyn] But I learned I was very comfortable that way.
translation.ko: 하지만 그 모습으로 있으면 편하다고 느꼈어요

translation.en: Thank you very much!
-[Caitlyn] But then the show… -[theme song plays]
It was an immediate, immediate change.
translation.ko: "4차원 가족 카다시안 따라잡기" 인생이 급속도로 바뀌었어요

translation.en: [Caitlyn] The world was different now.
It was just difficult, because I had so many secrets,
translation.ko: 너무 힘들었어요 제겐 비밀이 너무나 많았고

translation.en: and I'm sneaking around, trying to live a little bit of my life.
translation.ko: 제 삶을 조금이나마 누리려고 음지에서 돌아다녔거든요

translation.en: First, it's official. Bruce and Kris have separated after 22 years of marriage.
-Not "aww." You mean, "Good for Bruce." -[laughter]
[man] Bruce, are you happy to be single and free again?
[Caitlyn] When Kris and I went our separate directions,
translation.ko: 크리스랑 각자의 길을 가기로 했을 때

translation.en: I decided, "I can't take it any longer. I'm going to do this."
translation.ko: 더는 참을 수 없어서 행동에 옮기기로 결심했어요

translation.en: [man] Hey, Bruce, are you dating Ronda?
[Caitlyn] I started to have some surgeries,
but I wanted to keep that kind of quiet,
because I never talked to any of my kids about these issues.
translation.ko: 아이들에게는 이 문제에 대해 말한 적이 없었거든요

translation.en: And then I'd come out of a doctor's office in a back alley
translation.ko: 그러다 한 의료원 뒷골목으로 나온 적이 있어요

translation.en: uh, where I had a little tracheotomy, had the thing done.
And there was a picture that…
that TMZ was gonna print.
We broke a big story on the website
that Bruce Jenner has gone to a Beverly Hills plastic surgeon
to ditch his Adam's apple.
[man] Hey, Bruce, did you get a surgery? Any comments on that?
[man 2] Do you want people not to talk about your gender reassignment
and tell your daughters to keep it on the down-low?
[man 3] Kendall, are you upset about your dad's sex change?
[Caitlyn] My kids are seeing all of this…
and I still hadn't told them what was going on.
And that, to me, is the worst part of that time in my life. You know?
translation.ko: 그 시기에 제가 한 일 중에 가장 최악인 짓이죠 원래는 그보다 나은 아빠거든요

translation.en: Because I am a better parent than that, you know?
But I wasn't then.
Come on.
The goats are comin'.
[Burt] I'll never forget when my dad told me she is gonna transition.
translation.ko: 아빠가 성전환 얘기를 한 날을 절대 잊지 못할 거예요

translation.en: We went on this walk with the goats
and I said, you know, "Hey, Dad, I've… I've known for decades," you know, and…
translation.ko: 제가 이렇게 얘기했어요 '아빠, 전 진작 알고 있었잖아요'

translation.en: But there was something about the honesty and the…
translation.ko: 그런데도 아빠의 솔직함에서 느껴지는 힘이 있더라고요

translation.en: and the closeness, and the…
My father just putting the guard down,
which was something I don't see very often.
And it was a conversation that I'll cherish…
translation.ko: 그날 나눈 대화는 소중히 간직할 거예요

translation.en: more than any other conversation I've ever had with my father.
That was a really cool moment in my life.
translation.ko: 제 인생에 있어 참 멋진 순간이었어요

translation.en: And so, kind of the last hurdle I had to get over
was, um, uh, my faith in God.
And so, I invited my pastor over, and I told him my story.
And I basically asked him,
"In God's eyes, how does he see me? Am I doing the right thing?"
translation.ko: '주님은 저를 어떻게 보실까요? 제가 옳은 걸까요?'

translation.en: And I could never really get an answer.
But I had spent my entire life up to that point hiding.
translation.ko: 하지만 그 전까지 저는 평생을 숨어 살았어요

translation.en: Not being able to be myself.
I wanted to just smack everybody right across the face
and say, "Screw all you people. This is me."
translation.ko: 이렇게 말하고 싶었어요 '다들 꺼져, 이게 나야'

translation.en: "Accept it."
[Abby Wambach] Ladies and gentlemen, the courageous, the stunning Caitlyn Jenner.
translation.ko: 용감하고 아름다운 여성 케이틀린 제너를 소개합니다

translation.en: [Caitlyn] I remember when I got my driver's license.
Caitlyn Marie Jenner, gender marker F.
And the good news.
We're right down the middle.
I thought, "Wait a second. Can I do all the things I used to do?"
translation.ko: 이런 생각이 들더라고요 '전에 하던 것도 다 할 수 있나?'

translation.en: You know? I used to race cars, fly airplanes. Um…
translation.ko: 있잖아요, 카레이싱도 했고 비행기 조종도 했고

translation.en: You know, play golf and all that. Should I quit all that stuff?
translation.ko: 골프도 했었는데 다 관둬야 하는 걸까요?

translation.en: And after a while, I thought, "That's ridiculous."
translation.ko: 좀 지나고 깨달았죠 '말도 안 되는 소리네'

translation.en: Yeah. So I play golf, and I'm playing better than ever.
translation.ko: 그래서 골프를 계속 쳤고 실력은 전보다 나아요

translation.en: Turn! Ugh.
Didn't turn.
Kind of a bittersweet moment. Very excited, but on the other hand,
translation.ko: 시원섭섭한 기분이에요 매우 신나는 일이기도 하지만

translation.en: it was kind of wiping Bruce off the face of the Earth.
Sometimes they go, you know, "Oh, Caitlyn won the Games. It was really Caitlyn."
translation.ko: 이런 말을 가끔 들어요 '케이틀린이 올림픽에서 우승했어'

translation.en: And I go, "No, no, no, no, no. [laughs] Bruce won the Games."
translation.ko: 그럼 저는 그러죠 '아니, 그 사람은 브루스야'

translation.en: I have no problem saying that, okay?
I give him credit. He did that.
Now, was that all of me and my whole story?
Not even close. There's so much more to me than that.
translation.ko: 턱도 없죠, 브루스는 저의 일부일 뿐이에요

translation.en: But I do honor what he was able to do,
and I always call it Bruce, uh, 'cause Bruce did do that.
In hindsight, you know, I… I wonder, um…
if my dad wasn't trans, if my dad would have won.
I just wonder how much of that drive came from
wanting that acceptance from a group of men that he never-- she never felt
translation.ko: 남자들의 인정을 받고 싶은 데서 생겨난 건지 궁금한 거죠

translation.en: accepted by completely or never felt truly part of.
[Caitlyn] You know, I just turned 70.
I don't have that many years left.
One thing that I always wondered…
That day when you go up to the Pearly Gates,
and you stand there,
you ask God, "Why did you do this?"
"Why this issue is in my head?"
translation.ko: 왜 내 머릿속에 이런 생각을 심었을까요?

translation.en: You wonder, "Is there a reason for this?"
You get up there and say, "Hey, did I do a good job?"
Hopefully, he says, "Yes."
"You've raised a wonderful family."
"You've finally lived your life authentically."
It's all I can do and move on.
But now it's a new chapter, and let's see what Caitlyn can do.
End of story.
